# CODE PURPLE

## Emergency Response - Hostage Situation### What does it mean? Code Purple is the designated phrase used to alert staff to an incident where any person is being held against their will by another individual.### What do I do?#### If you are being held against your will:
- Remain calm. If spoken to, respond in a calm voice. - Do not be aggressive or use threatening language or body language. - Do not engage in conversation. - Never say “no”. - Review the Code Purple Taken Hostage Tip Sheet in the Code Purple policy.#### If you encounter a Code Purple situation:
- Remove other individuals from the vicinity for their own safety. If moving is not advisable, shelter in place behind secured doors. - Prevent traffic by closing doors to the affected area. - Do NOT announce a Code Purple. - Call 9-1-1. Be prepared to provide as much information as possible (i.e., location of the incident, number of hostage takers and hostages, physical description and names of hostage takers/hostages (if known), weapons involved, your name, location, and telephone number). - In unaffected areas, close and secure doors if possible.

Ask visitors and residents to remain where they are until the “All Clear” is announced.### Review it before you need it:
- Refer to your Home’s Emergency Planning and Management Manual, Code Purple. - Review the Code Purple plan, tip sheet, and checklists that describe your area’s role if a hostage situation occurs.
